senses.sense_definition: A covered shelter projecting in front of the entrance of a building.

examples.text: We sat on the front <w>porch</w> and watched the rain fall.
She left her muddy boots on the <w>porch</w> before entering the house.

senses.sense_definition: A covered walkway or structure with a roof supported by columns, often attached to a building.

examples.text: The ancient temple features a magnificent stone <w>porch</w>.
They walked along the shaded <w>porch</w> of the monastery.

senses.sense_definition: A platform located outside the external hatch of a spacecraft.

examples.text: The astronaut stood on the <w>porch</w> to prepare for the spacewalk.
Equipment was secured to the external <w>porch</w> of the module.
Mr. <w>Porch</w> has lived in this neighborhood for twenty years.
I have a meeting with Sarah <w>Porch</w> tomorrow morning.

senses.sense_definition: The Stoic philosophy, named after the painted colonnade in Athens where Zeno taught.

examples.text: He was a devoted student of the <w>Porch</w> and its teachings on virtue.
The philosophers of the <w>Porch</w> valued reason above all else.
